user_questions.text: Is using something like a Life Wheel (Wheel of Life) too much complexity? How to streamline core offering that easily goes social?
Here are some values cards - how can we get people to articulate values like these?

documents_provided.content: 6 values clusters with detailed 'WHERE MY ATTENTION GOES' bullet points
documents_provided.significance: Complete example set showing desired format for values articulation

people.name: Joe Edelman
people.contribution: Attentional Policies framework ('Where My Attention Goes')
people.notes: Implicit reference - values cards use his methodology but not named in this conversation

projects.name: Streamlined Reflection Tool
projects.description: End-of-year reflection tool combining YearCompass + Values Discovery + Future Visioning
features: Values Discovery (meaningful choice prompts → Values Cards)
Short Future Visioning (one question per life area)
Low-friction sharing (one-page PDF, social media ready)
projects.design_philosophy: Simplicity over complexity, social sharing for viral growth

projects.name: Year-End Reflection Tool
projects.notes: This is likely the same as the tool designed in Visionary Collaboration Framework conversation

concepts.name: Multi-Persona Thinking Framework
concepts.definition: Using multiple named personas (Quackers, Prunella, Cyril, Claude, Percy, Josephine) representing different thinking modes
concepts.source: Edward de Bono's Six Thinking Hats adapted with named personas
concepts.significance: Alternative to dual-agent framework - MORE perspectives (6 vs 2)

concepts.name: Attentional Policies (Joe Edelman)
concepts.definition: What you pay attention to reveals your values - captured as 'WHERE MY ATTENTION GOES' bullet points
concepts.application: Core methodology for values articulation in reflection tool
concepts.format: Scenario vignette + bullet list of attentional focus areas
examples: INTERACTIONS where both parties feel profound connection
SENSATIONS of feeling integral to another's life

concepts.name: Meaningful Choice Method
concepts.definition: Values discovery by reflecting on specific scenarios where something important was at stake
process: Name where your attention was (bullet points)
Check for non-instrumental care (intrinsic vs means-to-end)
Craft 'I am...' vignette + 'Where My Attention Goes' bullets
Give it a title (e.g., 'Soulful Talks', 'Deep Connections')
concepts.distinction: NOT abstract ideals ('I value connection') but grounded experiences

concepts.name: Life Wheel (Wheel of Life)
concepts.definition: Classic reflection tool - visual circle divided into life domains (health, career, relationships, etc.) rated 1-10
concepts.concern: Too much complexity, could overwhelm users
concepts.recommended_approach: Single 'Balance Check' page, 6-8 domains max, don't let it balloon the process

concepts.name: Values Card
concepts.definition: Single-page representation of a value with title, vignette, and attentional policies

structure.title: Evocative name (e.g., 'Timeless Love', 'Awakening Insights')
structure.vignette: 1-2 sentence 'I am...' scenario describing the value in action
structure.attentional_policies: Bullet list of 'WHERE MY ATTENTION GOES' items

concepts.clustering: Cards can group into themes (Connection, Contemplation, Exploration, etc.)

values.name: Simplicity & Accessibility in Tool Design
values.evidence: Repeated concern about 'too much complexity', 'keeping it simple', 'streamlined approach', 'don't overwhelm users'
values.context: Designing reflection tool that can go viral

values.name: Social Sharing & Viral Growth
values.evidence: Emphasis on 'low-friction sharing', 'social media ready', 'shareable summary card', 'peer feedback', 'word-of-mouth growth'
values.context: Business model thinking - free tool that spreads organically

values.name: Spiritual Wisdom in Secular Tool
values.evidence: Cyril (Sufi guide) quotes Rumi: 'Look past your thoughts, so you may drink the pure nectar of This Moment'
values.context: Multi-persona framework includes spiritual perspective alongside practical ones
values.connection_to_barakanomics: Same integration of spiritual + practical as Barakanomics philosophy

beliefs: Simplicity increases adoption - too many frameworks (YearCompass + Life Wheel + Moral Graph) overwhelm users
Social validation drives engagement - peer feedback and sharing make reflection sticky
Multi-perspective thinking yields better design - use 6 personas (Quackers, Prunella, etc.) to see all angles
Values must be grounded in experience, not abstract - 'I value connection' is vague, need specific scenarios
Spiritual wisdom has practical applications - Rumi quotes coexist with business model thinking
Free core product + paid premium services is sustainable model
mental_models: Multi-Persona Framework (6 thinking hats with named characters)
Attentional Policies (Joe Edelman) - what you notice reveals what you value
Meaningful Choice Method - values discovery through scenario reflection
Viral loop design - shareable outputs drive organic growth

decision_making_patterns.approach: Multi-perspective consultation (6 personas represent different priorities)
decision_making_patterns.seeks_clarity_on: How to balance simplicity (viral potential) with depth (meaningful values work)
decision_making_patterns.trade_offs: Life Wheel adds visual appeal BUT risks overwhelming users → make it optional
